comment.body:
My bad, I don't have iPhone so I have checked it on Android and Windows only and I couldn't reproduce it, because these requests are blocked on these platforms (I didn't realize that these requests are unblocked on iOS and Safari).
It looks like that it was added to fix this issue - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/144613 but I cannot reproduce this problem if I add `||ziffstatic.com/pg/$important` to user rules, so I will remove these exceptions.

comment.body:
@AdamWr 
Is it true that these are being blocked by the Base filter? 
Two of the rules you mentioned are included in the [Base filter](https://filters.adtidy.org/ios/filters/2_optimized.txt) that's subscribed by default on iOS.

```
@@||cdn.ziffstatic.com/pg/ign.js$domain=ign.com
@@||cdn.ziffstatic.com/pg/ign.prebid.js$domain=ign.com
```

issue.title: popteen.co.jp
issue.body: ### Issue URL (Ads) [https://popteen.co.jp/media/45176/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpopteen.co.jp%2Fmedia%2F45176%2F) ### Comment > This issue is caused by Adguard on iPhone's inability to handle iframes properly. There is no specific rule in place to hide the ad placeholder. On PC, blocking the script reduces the size to 0, effectively hiding the ad frame. However, on iPhone, the iframe remains visible, which is why it's expected that the ad frame does not disappear. If there are any other reasons contributing to this behavior, please let me know for future reference. > > ``` >
